answer:
Vaccines are not classified as vegetarian or vegan. Vaccines do not contain human or animal cells, tissue or blood. The Canadian Immunization Guide provides a list of all approved vaccines in Canada and their ingredients. 

		The meningococcal quadrivalent vaccine protects against four types of meningococcal bacteria, types A, C, Y and W and the vaccine is provided free to children in Grade 9 in BC.

		Tetanus, Diphtheria, Pertussis (Tdap) vaccine is offered to all students in Grade 9 in BC.

		These two vaccines do not contain human or animal cells, tissue or blood.
Immunization Nurse
question: My 14 year old son is now vegetarian and will not accept or use products where animals have been harmed or killed . He is due for MENC4 and TDP. Are these vegetarian/vegan?
